s32.message: To receive development build release notifications, subscribe to the RSS feed.

s48.message: Note that for various reasons, not every suggestion will be accepted. And remember, please stay constructive in your criticism.

s17.message: If Adblock Plus has improved your browsing experience, why not recommend it to your friends, colleagues or blog followers?

s56.message: If you come across a website on which an ad isn't blocked, or a filter list causes an issue, please report it.

s2.message: Adblock Plus is an open source, community-driven project. There are many ways for you to contribute to the project.

s6.message: Please support Adblock Plus if you like using it.

s5.message: {1} is an open source, community-driven project licensed under GPLv3 aimed at making the Internet better for everyone.

s55.message: These filter lists need to be constantly maintained to block menaces like new tracking systems, malware threats and intrusive ads.

s54.message: Share your filters, suggest new ones or help communities of volunteer contributors to draft and update filter lists.

s53.message: Adblock Plus is only as good as its filters.

s51.message: Visit the contribution page to make a donation.

s26.message: You may encounter a situation that is new to us, therefore we rely on your bug report to fix the issue.

s27.message: Please be sure to include all of the necessary information needed to reproduce the issue, such as: the browser and browser version, the version of Adblock Plus and the conditions in which the issue occurs.

s19.message: There are many ways you can help our cause:

s38.message: Have a look at the forum; there are always users looking for assistance with various Adblock Plus topics.

s35.message: Contributing to the Adblock Plus code is very involved and highly appreciated. There's a lot to do! Please see the contribute code page to get started.

s34.message: Whether you're fixing a bug or adding a new feature, code contribution is always welcome.

s37.message: If you are an experienced Adblock Plus user, consider answering questions from new users.

The purpose
          of these builds is to catch bugs and, sometimes, imperfect features before they are
          released to the public.

Notice.message: Eyeo GmbH, the company behind Adblock Plus, has no right to, or control over, any filter list content other than Acceptable Ads.

s30.message: Before a new version of Adblock Plus is released, several development builds are produced.

s25.message: If you think Adblock Plus isn't behaving the way it should, tell us.

s21.message: Share the installation link on your blog or on social networks.

s22.message: Discuss the benefits of installing Adblock Plus at your organization.

s45.message: There is always something that can be improved, so please share your ideas with us.

s46.message: We encourage you to not only tell us what needs to be changed, but explain to us how it should be changed.

s47.message: Feel free to open a new thread in the forum or join an existing discussion.

Adblock Plus is currently translated into more than 30 languagesÂ (yet some
          translations have been abandoned), and we still need translators for more

s41.message: To contribute as a translator, please register on Crowdin and join our translation projects: Adblock Plus for Firefox, Adblock Plus for Chrome, Element Hiding Helper, Customizations for Adblock Plus.

Select a language and start suggesting
          translations!

s43.message: If translating text isn't what you're looking for, you can simply vote on translations provided by other users.

s50.message: With more funds, we can improve Adblock Plus faster.

s28.message: Additionally, please be on the lookout for any follow-up questions we may have.

s23.message: Write an op/ed piece, or contact your local media, about Internet privacy and security issues.

s62.message: Criteria defining nonintrusive, and therefore acceptable ads, has been established based on strict guidelines.

s63.message: We encourage users to join the ongoing discussion to determine which ads qualify as acceptable ads. Visit the forum to share your thoughts.

s61.message: Eyeo is the originator behind the Acceptable Ads initiative, which is aimed at supporting websites that choose to use nonintrusive ads.
